评论概述: Great, but… the clasp isn’t great…
评论详情: Let me start by saying that I love this bracelet. It’s heavy, it’s strong and I’ve gotten a few compliments on it… But… the clasp is not strong. They have been a few times where I’ve been doing random things and the bracelet comes loose and falls off… and it’s all because of the clasp closure. This is where it could be better, and I think it’s because of the spring that might be in the clasp closure. This needs to be better, and I wish I could ask for a replacement. However, I doubt that would ever happen. (for the record, I have two of these, and my silver one doesn’t have this issue. It’s only the one in black.)

This is a very comfortable bracelet. It fits an average 8” wrist, and has a smooth underside. Nice size and not too heavy. It has a durable push button clasp that hasn’t come undone on its own, it’s a great design. This was a gift and he really enjoys wearing it.

评论概述: Beefy and Chunky.  Chunky and Beefy.
评论详情: The catalogue webpage depicts this as a masculine bracelet  with a tribal tattoo pattern.  All true!  But this bracelet is more than that.  The design is reminiscent of Polynesian tribal patterns (very cool).  Getting a little deeper into the webpage description reveals some impressive information.  The bracelet measures 22cm (8.6") long and weighs a whooping 150g (5.2oz).  There is no forgetting you are wearing this bracelet. The size and weight will remind you. Beefy, Chunky, Impressive, Stylish and Eye Catching are all good description.  Also well made can be added to that list.  let us not forget Very Cool.

This went way above and beyond my expectations.  The piece is solid and weighty. The craftsmanship is superb and the clasp is easy to use.

I'll be the first to admit that this style is not for everyone.  You will need to have a bit of mass/muscle to your body given the thickness of the bracelet. This bracelet is about as thick as a watch band and weighs about the same as the watch.  The design complements arm tattoos very well.  The length is very important, given how it needs to lie on your wrist and how far forward it can slip on your wrists. It will not be easy to remove a link for sizing purposes. As you can see from my picture you'll about 8.5 inches with the clasp closed. If you don't have a tape measure, take a piece of string, wrap it around your wrist, mark the length and lay it against a ruler. I think your minimum wrist size should be 7 in. to a max of 8 in. Anything outside of this will hang too loose or be too tight.  Lot's of complaints on the clasp, but I find it perfectly secure. You need to ensure it is inserted correctly and the latch is engaged. Give it a little tug to ensure the clasp is engaged before assuming it is secure.  Paired with a steel diver watch, this bracelet looks particularly nice.
